cyclone.name: DORIAN
cyclone.current_location: about 70 mi SSE of Charleston South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Moving north-northeast just offshore of the South Carolina coast, then turning northeast toward the North Carolina coast tonight and Friday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Very near the South Carolina coast between Charleston and Myrtle Beach (likely a coastal scrape rather than a true inland landfall)

weather_observation.watch_coast: North of Chincoteague VA to Fenwick Island DE, Chesapeake Bay from Smith Point to Drum Point, Tidal Potomac south of Cobb Island, Woods Hole MA to Sagamore Beach MA, Nantucket and Martha's Vineyard MA (Tropical Storm Watch area)
weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River GA to the North Carolina/Virginia border including Pamlico and Albemarle Sounds (Hurricane Warning) and Savannah River to Poquoson VA including local sounds/rivers (Storm Surge Warning)
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire South Carolina coastline, especially from Savannah River through Charleston to Myrtle Beach, then northward along the North Carolina Outer Banks
weather_observation.wind: Hurricane-force gusts (65–75 kt) and sustained tropical-storm to minimal hurricane winds expected Thursday morning through afternoon
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft above ground likely within Charleston Harbor and adjacent coastal areas, locally higher in the Isle of Palms–Myrtle Beach zone
weather_observation.rainfall: 6–12 inches of rain with isolated totals up to 15 inches possible, producing flash flooding in the Charleston metro area and along coastal South Carolina
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents, scattered tornadoes possible in outer rainbands, possible channel restrictions and debris affecting navigation
